data:
This two-year project, which is led by one of the main Headteacher organisations in England and Wales, addresses the problem of how to improve the performance of school leaders, particularly in their first few years of leadership. It builds a partnership of six organisations from five countries, all of whom have direct influence on the practice of school leaders. 

The overall aim is to develop an induction, coaching and mentoring programme for newly appointed school leaders, which exploits the proven expertise and capacity of experienced and recently retired members of partner organisations/associations. The partner organisations are in a unique position to exploit this expertise and already have a clear picture of need at a national level. Three of them have a dedicated 'retired members section'. They all have substantial experience of offering professional development. 

The objectives are to:
• establish a database in partner countries of high quality recently retired successful school leaders and select a team of trainers
• audit the priority needs of new school leaders across the partnership
• set up an online platform about the project and to host the resources
• create a coaching and mentoring programme for new school leaders
• train the trainers 
• pilot the coaching and mentoring programme with 150 new headteachers
• evaluate and finalise the resources
• create a set of case studies
• disseminate and promote the resources
• expand the programme into other countries 

There is much room for improvement to professionalise school leadership, to support current school leaders and to make school leadership an attractive career for future candidates. School leadership is a priority for the EU. This project focuses on how to up-skill school leaders, particularly in their early years of leadership. This is seen as a priority in the ET 2020 agenda if progress to meet targets on school performance is to be accelerated. 

The project has a number of main stages each with their own milestones and indicators and is divided into 3 sets of Intellectual Outputs.  These will be:

  •   An Integrated Platform, to host the project website, online resources and virtual community and network building tool
  •   A coaching and mentoring programme for new school leaders and a set of pilot training modules
  •   A set of final downloadable training modules for coaches, mentors and newly appointed school leaders, supported by an e-handbook 

In total there will be 50 coaches and mentors and 150 newly qualified Headteachers involved. An additional 30 key stakeholders per partner country will be targeted in the multiplier events, a total of 180 across the partnership. The final international conference will target 60 stakeholders at national and EU levels.
Lindfield Primary School French and Spanish Project

Project Aims - To introduce French teaching in KS2 in line with new requirements. To promote linguistic confidence among staff to facilitate effective French teaching in KS2 and Spanish teaching in KS1and EY

Objective - to increase vocabulary, confidence and competencies of staff.
                      to increase an awareness of methodologies
                      to initiate a sustained and meaningful link with a partner school

Summer term- whole school French staff meeting with support of local secondary school.

First year - MFL coordinator and 3 teachers to attend an intensive language and methodology course in France, and visit a primary school in France with a view to full immersion in school life and establishing a regular and meaningful link with our pupils.

End of first year carry out a pupil and staff questionnaire to see the impact from the first year.

Second year - 3 teachers from KS2 to attend  an intensive language and methodology course in France, to enable our parallel teachers to increase their vocabulary and French skills and to introduce them to our partner school.

2 teachers to attend an intensive language and methodology course in Spain and spend time in a Spanish Primary school.

End of second year - carry out Europass and evaluate next steps for future to ensure progression and succession and embedded quality first teaching.
